de.eckhartarnold.client

Class Layout

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.eckhartarnold.client.Layout
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    FullScreenLayout, HTMLLayout

    public abstract class Layout
extends java.lang.Object
    Abstract base class for all layout classes for the slide show.

    The layout classes define how and where these elements are placed. A "layout" for the slide show always contains the image panel on which the slides are shown and it may contain (usually it does) a control panel to control the slide show and a caption where the captions of those images that have a caption are displayed.

    Author:
    ecki

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected Caption caption
      The widget that display the caption.
      protected SlideshowControl control
      The control panel widget.
      protected Filmstrip filmstrip
      The film strip widget which, if present at all, is usually "swallowed" by the control panel.
      protected ImagePanel imagePanel
      The widget on which the images are displayed.
      static java.lang.String KEY_CLICKABLE
      the key in the "info.json" dictionary that determines whether by clicking on an image a window with its full sized version is opened.
      static java.lang.String KEY_DISABLE_SCROLLING
      the key in the "info.json" dictionary that determines whether the window scrollbars shall be turned of when attaching the image panel.
      protected Slideshow slideshow
      The Slideshow object controlling the slide show.
      static java.lang.String STD_CFG
      The standard configuration of the layout: control panel at the top, image panel in the middle, caption at the bottom.

    • Field Detail

      • KEY_CLICKABLE

        public static final java.lang.String KEY_CLICKABLE
        the key in the "info.json" dictionary that determines whether by clicking on an image a window with its full sized version is opened. The value can be either "true" or "false", default is "true".
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • KEY_DISABLE_SCROLLING

        public static final java.lang.String KEY_DISABLE_SCROLLING
        the key in the "info.json" dictionary that determines whether the window scrollbars shall be turned of when attaching the image panel. (This may be useful for avoiding flickering, but should not be used when the slide show is embedded in a larger html page so that it does not occupy the whole page alone!)
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • STD_CFG

        public static final java.lang.String STD_CFG
        The standard configuration of the layout: control panel at the top, image panel in the middle, caption at the bottom.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Constructor Detail

      • Layout

        public Layout(ImageCollectionInfo collection,
              java.lang.String configuration)
        Creates a new layout object.
        Parameters:
        collection - the information about the image collection
        configuration - the configuration string for the layout

      • Layout

        public Layout(ImageCollectionInfo collection)
        Creates a new layout object. The layout object created with this constructor does contain a ControlPanel. It will also contain a Caption unless the captions of all images are empty.
        Parameters:
        collection - the information about the image collection

    • Method Detail

      • getCaption

        public Caption getCaption()
        Returns the Caption object, if the layout contains a caption.
        Returns:
        the Caption object or null

      • getSlideshowControl

        public SlideshowControl getSlideshowControl()
        Returns the SlideshowControl object, if the layout contains a control panel.
        Returns:
        the SlideshowControl object or null

      • getImagePanel

      • getSlideshow

        public Slideshow getSlideshow()
        Returns the Slideshow object.
        Returns:
        the Slideshow object

      • getRootWidget

        public abstract Widget getRootWidget()
        Returns the root widget of the layout. The widget can be inserted anywhere in a web site. After attaching the root widget to the web site, method issueResize should be called to make sure that the layout's size is adjusted properly.
        Returns:
        the root widget of the layout

      • issueResize

        public void issueResize()
        Calls the prepareResized and onResized methods of the widgets associated with this layout. This method should be called after attaching the layout's root widget to the DOM-tree!
